conclusion: Consider the motion of the frame through the magnetic field and conditions for induced current.
The frame is a square with side length l, magnetic field width is d, frame speed is v, and l < d.
Induced current occurs when magnetic flux through the frame changes.
Induced current occurs when the frame enters or exits the magnetic field.
Frame starts entering the magnetic field when the left side reaches the left boundary.
Frame fully enters the magnetic field when the right side reaches the left boundary.
Time taken to fully enter the magnetic field is l/v.
Frame starts exiting the magnetic field when the left side reaches the right boundary.
Frame fully exits the magnetic field when the right side reaches the right boundary.
Time taken to fully exit the magnetic field is l/v.
Total time with induced current is the sum of entering and exiting times: 2l/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is 2l/v.
